content:
• Wednesday, March 8, 2017
  • SMTC

    Semtech +6.3%; Q4 2017, outlook positive

    • Q4 2017 results – revenue $141.8M (+18% Y/Y, $3.43M above estimates), EPS $0.37 ($0.02 above estimates), net income $24.5M, gross margin 60.5%, operating expense $52.2M, operating margin 23.7%
    • Q1 2018 projections – revenue $142M-$150M (consensus $141.42M), EPS $0.39-$0.43 (consensus $0.36), gross margin 60%-61%, SG&A expense $26.5M-$27.5M, R&D expense $23.5M-$24.5M, interest and other expense $2.3M, tax rate 20%-24%
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:SMTC) $36.45
    • Press release / conference call / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 2 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: ELF +13.6%. SMTC +6.1%. LPI +2.8%. BETR +2.7%. KOS +2.1%.
    • Top losers: TLRD -27.3%. SPPI -14.0%. VNET -4.3%. CWH -4.2%. SFS -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • CMTL

    Comtech Telecom +4.7% on fiscal Q2 beats, upbeat profit guidance

    • Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) is up 4.7% after hours following fiscal Q2 earnings that beat expectations and guided to higher-than-expected profit for the year.
    • Revenues nearly doubled thanks to last February's acquisition of TeleCommunication Systems. EBITDA, including a $10M intellectual property litigation settlement, was $13.5M (vs. $10.4M expected).
    • Book-to-bill ratio was 0.94 (boosted by a 1.22 in its Commercial Solutions segment). Backlog as of Jan. 31 was $453.3M.
    • In updated guidance for fiscal 2017, it's set revenue targets to $570M-$580M (down from $600M and below consensus for $595.4M), and set GAAP EPS goals at $0.68 (including $0.27 tied to the favorable settlement, and vs. an expected $0.30). It's forecast EBITDA for $70M vs. consensus of $67.3M.
    • Conference call to come tomorrow at 8:30 a.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • PLNT

    Planet Fitness down 2.4% on share sale

    • Certain stockholders have put 15M shares up for sale. The company will receive no proceeds from the offering.
    • PLNT -2.4% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • TGTX

    TG Therapeutics raising capital, -3% after hours

    • The size of the equity offering isn't noted. It will include a greenshoe to the underwriter Jefferies for up to another 15% of the shares sold.
    • TGTX -2.9% after hours
    • Previously: TG Therapeutics's blood cancer candidate ublituximab successful in late-state study; shares jump 53% premarket (March 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 16 Comments
  • SBGI

    Sinclair Broadcast sets up offering of 12M shares

    • Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI -1.7%) has set a public offering of its Class A common stock.
    • The company will sell 12M primary shares, with a 30-day option to buy up to an additional 1.8M shares on the same terms.
    • Proceeds will go to "fund future potential acquisitions" and for general purposes.
    • Joint book-runners are Wells Fargo, J.P. Morgan and RBC Capital Markets.
    • Shares are flat at $41.60 in some choppy aftermarket trades.
    • Updated 5:18 p.m.: Shares are off 1.9% in postmarket trade.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharma Q4 top line down 30%, net loss widens; shares down 15% after hours

    • Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SPPI) Q4 results ($M): Total Revenues: 35.2 (-30.0%); Product Sales: 32.2 (-7.5%).
    • Net Loss: (17.4) (-314.3%); Non-GAAP Net Loss: (8.1) (-76.1%); Loss/Share: (0.22) (-266.7%); Non-GAAP Loss/Share: (0.10) (-42.9%).
    • BLA filing in U.S. for ROLONTIS expected in 2018.
    • Results from investigator-sponsored study of poziotinib in NSCLC expected by year end.
    • Special protocol assessment received from FDA related to Phase 3 study of Qapzola in non-muscle invasive bladder cancer.
    • Shares are off 15% after hours on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • TLRD

    Dizzying fall for Tailored Brands after earnings

    • Tailored Brands (NYSE:TLRD) craters after Q4 results miss estimates by a wide margin.
    • Comparable sales fell 5.2% for the K&G brand during the quarter and dropped 2.2% for the Jos. A Bank chain.
    • "The challenging retail environment resulted in soft traffic across our retail brands, which drove lower than anticipated fourth quarter and full year net sales and gross margins," says CEO Doug Ewert.
    • The company expects 2017 EPS of $1.45 to $1.75.
    • Previously: Tailored Brands misses by $0.07, misses on revenue (March 8)
    • TLRD -22.55% AH to $18.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • RATE

    Bankrate -6.9% as Q4 profits, revenues miss

    • Bankrate (RATE +1.6%) has slid 6.9% after hours following misses on the top and bottom line in its Q4 earnings, though net profits increased slightly on strength in its key credit cards segment.
    • Revenues were up nearly 22% and EBITDA rose 7% to $30.4M, slightly below an expected $31.4M.
    • "We are laser-focused on continuing to scale revenue, while accelerating adjusted EBITDA growth," said CEO Kenneth Esterow.
    • Revenue by segment: Credit cards, $83.7M (up 32%); Banking, $26.2M (up 6%); Senior care, $5.4M (down 14%);
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenues of $115M-$118M (above consensus for $114.2M) and EBITDA of $26M-$28M (vs. consensus for $28.2M). For the full year, it's forecasting revenues of $500M-$515M (above an expected $498.3M) and EBITDA of $122M-$129M (vs. consensus for $124.2M).
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • WATT

    Energous -9%; Q4 2016 off expectations

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $0.13M ($0.26M below estimates), EPS -$0.75 ($0.21 below estimates), net loss $14.6M, operating expenses $14.7M ($9.7M R&D, $4M general and administrative, $1M sales and marketing), adjusted EBITDA loss $10.2M, cash and cash equivalents $31.M with no debt
    • Energous president and CEO Stephen Rizzone: "Energous is on track to develop and successfully commercialize a new technology that has never before been available, and that will have what we believe is a far-reaching impact on the consumer and enterprise markets. The company is working toward shipping fully commercialized WattUp chipsets, expanding its customer base, and securing FCC approval for its longer range charging solutions. We are singularly focused on building a highly relevant and valuable company for the long-term, and firmly believe we will exit this year positioned for significant, ongoing growth."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:WATT) $13.68
    • Press release / conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 18 Comments
  • BCRX

    BioCryst readies $45M equity offering; shares slip 4% after hours

    • BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BCRX) eases 4% after hours on modestly higher volume in response to it proposed $45M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Today's close was $8.41.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 5 Comments
  • AGRX

    Agile Therapeutics beats by $0.10

    • Agile Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AGRX): Q4 EPS of -$0.18 beats by $0.10.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • FOLD

    Amicus launches migalastat in Italy; shares ahead 3% after hours

    • Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) perks up 3% after hours on average volume on the heels of its announcement that it has launched Galafold (migalastat) for the long-term treatment of patients at least 16 years old with Fabry disease in Italy.
    • CEO John Crowley says, "The commercial launch of Galafold in Italy is a significant milestone for the Fabry community. All Fabry patients in Italy 16 years and older who have an amenable mutation will now have access to the first oral treatment as well as the first precision medicine for their Fabry disease. We believe that our successful pricing and reimbursement in Italy is a testament to the significant value of our oral precision medicine, and reflects our growing momentum with the country-by-country processes to launch Galafold throughout the EU.”
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 6 Comments
  • BETR

    Tyrrells powers growth at Amplify Snack Brands

    • Amplify Snack Brands (NYSE:BETR) reports sales growth of 91% in Q4 as the acquisition of the Tyrrell's business factored in.
    • Gross profit as a percentage of sales fell to 41.5% vs. 56.5% a year ago. Adjusted EBITDA was 26.6% of sales vs. 40.4% a year ago.
    • "Our fourth quarter financial performance reflects the strong momentum for our SkinnyPop, Paqui and Oatmega brands, and the addition of Tyrrells," notes CEO Tom Ennis.
    • Looking ahead, Amplify expects revenue of $404M to $420M and EPS of $0.43 to $0.51.
    • BETR +2.79% AH to $9.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • TNDM

    Tandem Diabetes Care beats by $0.17, beats on revenue

    • Tandem Diabetes Care (NASDAQ:TNDM): Q4 EPS of -$0.48 beats by $0.17.
    • Revenue of $24.8M (-14.8% Y/Y) beats by $2.05M.
    • Shares +11.6% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM

    Vivus beats by $0.31, beats on revenue

    • Revenue of $81.8M (+433.2% Y/Y) beats by $32.98M.
    • Shares +6.7% AH.

    e.l.f. Beauty beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    Amplify Snack misses by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Revenue of $88.6M (+91.1% Y/Y) beats by $1.32M.
    • Shares +3% AH.

    Points International EPS of -$0.24

    • Points International (NASDAQ:PCOM): Q4 EPS of -$0.24 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.09.
    • Revenue of $82M (+2.2% Y/Y) misses by $6.22M.
    • Shares +3% AH.

  • TVIAQ

    TerraVia beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • TerraVia (TVIA): Q4 EPS of -$0.20 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $4.8M (-11.1% Y/Y) beats by $0.53M.
    • Shares +19% AH.

  • CVX

    Chevron starts production at Mafumeira Sul project offshore Angola

    • Chevron (CVX -2%) says its Cabinda Gulf Oil subsidiary has started oil and gas production from the primary production facility for its Mafumeira Sul project offshore Angola.
    • The field lies ~15 miles from the Angolan coast under 60 ft. of water and is expected to produce ~150K bbl/day of natural gas liquids and 350M cf/day of natural gas per day.
    • Initial production started last September with the ramp up to full production expected to be completed by next year.
    • CVX, through the local subsidiary, operates and owns a 39.2% stake in the Mafumeira Sul project, Sonangol holds a 41% interest, and Total (NYSE:TOT) and Eni (NYSE:E) comprise the remaining 10% and 9.8% shares, respectively.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • O

    Rough session for REITs as 10-year yield hits 2017 high

    • Helped along by a big 298K gain in February jobs reported by the ADP (the government reports on Friday), the 10-year Treasury yield is higher today by four basis points to 2.56% - pretty close to its highest level since the election.
    • Meanwhile on the short end, traders have priced in a 100% chance of a FOMC rate hike next week, with the next move after that coming by Labor Day (seems late given recent Fed talk).
    • While the S&P 500 and Dow are down just modestly, and the Nasdaq positive, the IYR is off 1.6% and VNQ 1.9% as REITs begin to face more serious competition in the yield department.
    • Realty Income (O -3.7%), Vereit (VER -3.7%), Omega Health (OHI -2.1%), HCP (HCP -3.1%), W.P. Carey (WPC -2.4%), Essex Property (ESS -1.2%), Simon Property (SPG -1.6%), Kimco (KIM -2.2%), Public Storage (PSA -1.9%), Government Properties (GOV-OLD -4.3%), Stag Industrial (STAG -2.7%), AGNC Investment (AGNC -2.1%), Annaly (NLY -1.6%)
    • ETFs: VNQ, IYR, MORL, REM, MORT, DRN, RQI, URE, SCHH, ICF, RWR, SRS, RNP, RFI, JRS, KBWY, NRO, DRV, RIT, RIF, REK, DRA, FRI, FTY, FREL, LRET, PSR, WREI, XLRE, IARAX, RORE, USRT
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 82 Comments
  • GOLD

    Randgold Resources downgraded, Pretium Resources upgraded at RBC

    • Randgold Resources (GOLD -1.6%) is downgraded to Underperform from Sector Perform at RBC Capital, which sees valuation edging back from peak levels.
    • As GOLD's current growth phase comes to an end, with uncertainty remaining on the next value creation source and an equity that RBC views as more than fairly priced, the firm expects the stock to underperform peers.
    • At the same time, RBC upgrades Pretium Resources (PVG +2.6%) to Outperform from Sector Perform, expecting the stock to re-rate over the coming months as the Brucejack project successfully ramps up following commissioning in Q2.
    • With convertible financing closed, the firm thinks PVG has more than sufficient funds to bring Brucejack into production.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • SNAP

    Snap rebounds 7%; Tepper a fan

    • Appearing on CNBC this morning, a generally bullish (on markets overall) David Tepper says he was a buyer of Snap (NYSE:SNAP) on the IPO. Tepper personally isn't a user, but his daughter is, and the demographics (the "anti-Facebook") are interesting to him.
    • Tepper does say he sold some shares when the stock popped into the high $20s just after the IPO, but he'd be a buyer again if the price falls back towards the offering level ($17).
    • Snap +6.9% to $22.92
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 75 Comments
  • PBYI

    Puma Bio claws back from Roche data-stoked drop; shares up 12%

    • Last Thursday's nearly 14% plunge in Puma Biotechnology (PBYI +11.9%) is now a memory. The sell-off was stoked by Roche's announcement of positive late-stage data on Perjeta (pertuzumab) in HER2+ breast cancer. The negative connotations for Puma's HER2+ breast cancer candidate neratinib (PB272) had investors racing to the exits. No more. Shares have rallied over 40% since then.
    • Stifel's Thomas Shrader: "People are feeling they overreacted. Puma's neratinib remains a good drug for patients that have progressed on other treatments and works best in HR-positive patients, where Perjeta + Herceptin appear weakest." He rates Puma a Buy.
    • Citigroup is also bullish, advising clients to "buy the drop." RBC begs to differ, however, saying neratinib is having "a very tough time being commercially relevant."
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Puma Bio sinks after Roche announces positive Perjeta data in HER2+ breast cancer; shares off 25% premarket (March 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 2 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: PRSS +16%. EXTR +14%. MOMO +12%. OTC:SOFO +12%. QUIK +12%.
    • Losers: MOSY -12%. IDT -10%. CIEN -9%. HTCO -9%. OCC -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • ARCH

    Met coal stocks to see more pressure on China, Seaport Global says

    • Met coal exposed stocks likely will see further pressure as China said it will avoid coal mining limits if prices remain “reasonable,” according to Seaport Global’s Head of Energy Trading.
    • Speculation says China will reinstate its 276-day operating limit at the end of the Chinese winter, with the news likely to impact met coal stocks such as Arch Coal (ARCH -3.1%) and Natural Resource Partners (NRP +1.6%).
    • Among the world's top coking coal producers are BHP Billiton (BHP -4%), Teck Resources (TECK -1.4%), Rio Tinto (RIO -1.8%) and Anglo American (OTCQX:AAUKF, OTCPK:AAUKY).
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 6 Comments
  • BCRX

    BioCryst Pharma up nearly 10% after JMP note

    • BioCryst's (BCRX +9.5%) BCX7353 led to a clinically meaningful reduction in hereditary angioedema attacks, says analyst Liisa Bayko, citing HAE expert Dr. Marc Riedl.
    • Unwanted side effects from the Feb. 27 APeX-1 data are "partially muddled," she says, as patients may not be able to distinguish between GI side effects and HAE attacks.
    • The stock's now higher by more than 50% since those results.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • CIEN

    Ciena -8.4% post-earnings; Wells Fargo, Dougherty & Company reiterate bullishly

    • Considering "moderate" revenue shortfall as likely lending to disappointing sentiment, analyst Jess Lubert (Wells Fargo) nevertheless suggests positive demand trends across the majority of key regions (excluding Latin America) and product segments support firm's thesis 100G metro upgrades, data center interconnect prospects and packet networking deployments will generate sound sales trends in FY 2017. Restates Outperform, $30-$32 valuation range.
    • Reissuing at Buy and $26 target, analyst Catharine Trebnick attributes revenue misstep to Global Services softness (-18% sequentially), while noting revenue outlook going forward is largely in line with firm's and consensus estimates.
    • Ciena (NASDAQ:CIEN) $23.96.
    • Earlier (March 8, 2017): Ciena -3% pre-market; Q1 2017 off estimates, Q2 revenue forecast midpoint over / earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • VALE

    Nickel posts biggest two-day loss since 2015 on ore export plan

    • Nickel prices concluded their biggest two-day loss since 2015 after PT Aneka Tambang, a top Indonesian nickel producer, said it is taking steps to resume low-grade ore exports.
    • Nickel settled 4.2% lower at $10,200/ton on the LME, and dropped 8.1% in two days, the most since August 2015.
    • “Reports that Indonesia may finally allow nickel ore imports after a three-year ban caught a long market badly offsides," BMO Capital says. “Stops were triggered that drove nickel lower in high volume trade."
    • Relevant tickers: VALE -3.8%, BHP -1.8%, RIO -1.8%.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 3 Comments
  • GSAT

    Globalstar, Inmarsat teaming up on selling satellite service

    • Globalstar (GSAT +0.7%) and Inmarsat (OTCPK:IMASY +7%) have the framework of a deal to cross-sell satellite products and services, extending the power of each into a global customer base.
    • The move would combine Globalstar's strength in low-earth orbiting satellites with Inmarsat's in geostationary birds.
    • A formal agreement is expected within weeks; both companies will operate independently otherwise.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 15 Comments

  • Oil tumbles more than 4% after inventory data; put volume surges

    • The API last night reported a whopping inventory build of more than 11M barrels, and the EIA this morning more than 8M.
    • Black gold is lower by 4.1% to a six-week low $50.94 per barrel.
    • Bloomberg takes note of 220K puts traded on the U.S. Oil Fund (USO -4.2%) today vs. the 20-day average of 47K. Call volume today is 57K.
    • The XLE is down 1.9% this session vs. the Dow and S&P 500 flat.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, XLE, UCO, VDE, ERX, OIH, SCO, XOP, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, DTO, UGA, USL, DUG, BGR, IYE, IEO, FENY, DNO, PXE, FIF, OLO, PXJ, UHN
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 55 Comments

  • NTRA

    Natera under pressure after Q4 miss and sell-siders' modified outlooks; shares down 15%

    • Molecular testing firm Natera (NTRA -15.1%) slumps on a 5x surge in volume on the heels of its Q4 miss released after the close yesterday. Revenues came in at $49.3M which fell short of consensus by ~$500K and were down almost 7% yoy.
    • Q4 tests processed: 117K (+21.9%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Revenues: $210M - 230M; product sales: 60 -65% of revenues; cash burn: $85M - 95M.
    • Baird trimmed its price target to $15 (79% upside), Morgan Stanley to $19, Canaccord to $14 and Piper to $18.
    • Previously: Natera misses by $0.16, misses on revenue (March 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: GBT +23%. MYOS +20%. SPEX +19%. PLCE +19%. AUXO +16%. CYCC +16%. HRB +16%. EXTR +15%. NMM +14%. PRSS +14%.
    • Losers: FLKS -16%. NTRA -15%. CRC -14%. NATR -14%. BCEI -13%. EXPR -12%. PN -12%. NSPR -11%. PQ -11%. OPTT -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 6 Comments
  • FLKS

    Flex Pharma meets Q4 revenue consensus, but slow HOTSHOT ramp disappoints investors; shares down 16%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Flex Pharma (FLKS -15.6%) is under pressure on more than double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 162K shares. The company beat Q4 expectations, but the slow sales ramp of muscle cramp-buster HOTSHOT has investors hitting the sell button.
    • HOTSHOT, launched in June 2016, generated sales of only $299K in Q4 despite being sampled by over 20K athletes and 200 sports teams and the recruitment of "ambassadors" to endorse/promote the product.
    • The company says HOTSHOT works by stimulating sensory neurons in the mouth, stomach and esophagus which send impulses to the spinal cord that inhibit and overpower repetitive signals coming to and from cramped muscle.
    • Piper Jaffray's Joshua Schimmer maintains his Overweight rating but lowered the price target to $12 (300% upside) from $15.
    • Previously: Flex Pharma beats by $0.18, beats on revenue (March 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: MGPI +7%. SPU +7%. ABAC-OLD +6%.
    • Losers: KODK -10%. THST -6%. VNCE -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • CLRB

    Cellectar Bio in-licenses exclusive rights to CLR 131 in multiple myeloma; shares ahead 5%

    • Cellectar Biosciences (CLRB +4.9%) perks up on average volume in response to its announcement that it has formerly secured exclusive global rights to develop lead product candidate CLR 131 for multiple myeloma via a license agreement with shareholder Wisconsin Alumni Research Foundation (WARF).
    • CEO Jim Caruso says, “WARF is one of Cellectar’s largest shareholders and remains a formidable partner. We believe this expansion of our relationship further solidifies our mutual commitment. Acquiring the remaining rights to the use of CLR 131 in multiple myeloma now provides us with complete control over the product’s development and commercialization in all therapeutic areas.”
    • CLR 131 is a phospholipid ether-drug conjugate that selectively delivers a cytotoxic payload to cancer cells.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 16 Comments
  • HLF

    SA Contributor QTR still bearish on Herbalife, sees over 40% downside risk; shares ease 1%

    • Herbalife (HLF -0.8%) slips after SA Contributor Quoth the Raven Research published a bearish article postulating that shares could drop below $30 (43% downside risk).
    • QTR cites likely downward pressure on the stock from the critical documentary Betting on Zero that will hit U.S. theaters this Friday. Additional factors weighing on the stock are stalling revenues in former high-growth China and the chance that activist investor Carl Icahn may unload his large stake before the film debuts (based on prior history).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 168 Comments
  • CIA

    Citizens, Inc. -14%; targeted by SA contributor

    • "Citizens (CIA -13.7%) displays some characteristics that appear analogous to a Ponzi scheme," writes Seeking Alpha contributor Aurelius.
    • Time could be running short, he says, as financials show many existing policyholders asking to be cashed out while new sales have plummeted, and longtime insiders have exited.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • IPIX

    Cellceutix reports encouraging early data from mid-stage study of Brilacidin in UC; shares ahead 4%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Cellceutix (CTIX +3.8%) perks up on the heels of its announcement of positive interim results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing antibiotic Brilacidin to induce remission in patients with mild-to-moderate ulcerative colitis (UC).
    • All 12 subjects in the first two cohorts achieved a beneficial response, while 50% achieved clinical remission at day 42. The remaining six patients achieved a partial response.
    • Brilacidin is a member of a new class of antibiotics called defensin-mimetics, which are modeled after host defense proteins. These are the "front line" of defense in the human immune system. An oral rinse formulation is in Phase 2 development for the treatment of chemoradiation-associated oral mucositis.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 23 Comments
  • GBT

    Global Blood up 12% on Novo Nordisk interest

    • Global Blood Therapeutics (GBT +12.2%) jumps on a 4x surge in volume on the rumor that insulin king Novo Nordisk (NVO -0.8%) has approached it about a possible transaction.
    • GBT's lead product candidate is GBT440, a once-daily therapy to treat sickle cell disease.
    • Update: Jacob Plieth tweeted that he heard a rumor that NVO's board has authorized a bid up to $45.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 7 Comments
  • BWLD

    Lack of insider buying at Buffalo Wild Wings questioned

    • Marcato Capital Management LP issues a biting report on the lack of insider buying at Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD -0.5%).
    • Marcatto on BWLD:  "Since its IPO in 2003, Buffalo Wild Wings' Board and Management team have sold the vast majority of all stock ever owned.  In our view, this lack of long-term ownership has contributed to failures of governance and oversight, poor capital allocation discipline and the severe lack of urgency in navigating the difficult operating environment.  Shareholders deserve a Board and management team that is willing to commit its own capital alongside them."
    • The firm holds a 5.6% position in the restaurant company.
    • If Buffalo Wild Wings issues a response to the Marcato charge it will be posted.
    • Shares of BWD have outperformed the USCF Restaurant Leaders ETF (NYSEARCA:MENU) so far this year.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment

  • NTLA

    Intellia boosts gene editing efficiency with LNP technology; shares up 9%

    • Intellia Therapeutics (NTLA +9.1%) reports updated data from an animal model study that showed increased levels of genome editing efficiency with CRISPR/Cas9 when combined with its lipid nanoparticle (LNP) technology. In mouse liver, a single administration produced a 97% reduction in serum transthyretin (TTR) protein implying gene editing efficiency of 70%. The data are being presented today at Cowen's 37th Annual Healthcare Conference in Boston.
    • EVP, R&D John Leonard, M.D. says, “These results are extremely promising, as they demonstrate compelling activity with lipid nanoparticles observed in the liver following a single dose. We are excited by the extent of the effect, which confirms the power of CRISPR/Cas9 for potential therapeutic uses. These high levels of gene editing are the result of Intellia’s effort to identify highly efficient delivery of CRISPR/Cas9 using lipid nanoparticles. The data advance our efforts as we look to transform the way we treat disease.”

  • OCRX

    Further analysis of mid-stage data showed Ocera's lead product candidate lowered ammonia levels faster than standard of care in HE patients; shares up 51% premarket

    • Nano cap Ocera Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OCRX) rockets 51% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of positive data from its continued analysis of its Phase 2b STOP-HE study assessing lead product candidate OCR-002 (ornithine phenylacetate) in hospitalized patients with hepatic encephalopathy (HE). The results will be presented today at Cowen's 37th Annual Healthcare Conference.
    • Shares plummeted in January after the company announced that STOP-HE failed to achieve its primary endpoint. Specifically, OCR-002 failed to beat placebo as measured by time to improvement in HE symptoms.
    • A further analysis of the results showed treatment with OCR-002 rapidly and safely lowered ammonia in HE patients to levels associated with clinical improvement. The company intends to advance OCR-002 into Phase 3 development.
    • Ornithine phenylacetate is an ammonia scavenger that reduces excess ammonia in patients with liver cirrhosis and acute liver failure. Elevated ammonia causes swelling in the brain producing symptoms of HE.
    • Previously: Ocera's lead product candidate flunks mid-stage HE study; shares plummet 59% premarket (Jan. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 10 Comments
